answers.answer: HI,How are you? How is your father? A high serum creatinine level may suggest kidney issues  and may warrant  further evaluation and additional diagnostic tests to confirm the result and to determine if the kidneys are functioning well. Creatinine levels may temporarily increase also if there is dehydration, a low blood volume, medication side effect or a large amount of meat in the diet. Diabetes control as well as managing his blood pressure are important to prevent further damage. Take care and do keep us posted. Best regards.
